source.4fc127b1:
lm1 = sm.OLS(train_y, train_x).fit()
pdct1 = lm1.predict(test_x)
print(pdct1)

source.3c79ec88:
from sklearn import metrics  
print('Mean Absolute Error:', metrics.mean_absolute_error(test_y, pdct1))  
print('Mean Squared Error:', metrics.mean_squared_error(test_y, pdct1))  
print('Root Mean Squared Error:', np.sqrt(metrics.mean_squared_error(test_y, pdct1)))
source.7121c32f: # Standard deviation : Standard deviation is a measure of how spared a typical observation is from the average.where the deviation is how far from the average you are...In this data we have average Confirmed cases is 252 but the standard deviation is 6237.239754. if the SD and average is same value so there is no issue, but here compare to confirmed average cases we have a huge SD cases.

source.7382f15a: # MEDIAN: The median is a simple measure of central tendency. If there is an odd number of observations, the median is the middle value. If there is an even number of observations, the median is the average of the two middle values.
